reference.shortdesc: The serviced backup command saves a snapshot of the current state of the system, the state of all services, and data to a compressed archive file (.tgz). You can exclude certain directories from a backup, such as a directory that contains application performance data.

section.p: For more information about backing up and restoring, see .

dlentry.dd:
Subdirectory of the tenant volume to exclude from a backup.
Example: To exclude a directory under /opt/serviced/var/volumes/TENANT, such as hbase-master, which contains performance data, use the following command:
serviced backup --exclude=hbase-master
To exclude multiple directories, use multiple --exclude options.
Shows the help for an option.
